page.title: 01A General Survey
page.content: Hassocks and the surrounding area lie just north of the{South Downs}8 miles from the{coast}and{Brighton.}Hassocks and Keymer are the largest centres of population within the area. Hurstpierpoint lies to the west and Clayton to the south. The area has good accessibility with frequent trains on the London to Brighton railway stopping at Hassocks. Buses also provide local and express services. The A23 road is nearby. Residents are mainly{commuters}with some work in farming, local shops and small businesses. The housing is mainly new, privately owned with some very old cottages. The main services are one secondary and two primary schools, a fire station, library, hotel, six churches and recreation grounds.
